latestReviews.body: Based on discussion, this is a temporary fix for Bitmap implementation and is already handled in VRF implementation

reviews.body: Based on discussion, this is a temporary fix for Bitmap implementation and is already handled in VRF implementation

comments.body: Do we have any vs test cases to cover this fix?

@zhenggen-xu I think we have done enough more for backward compatibility just warmboot from old version. In the near future, the codes would have no use. Even now in the process of running, it will never happen as the entries are written by fpmsyncd. So I think there is no need to add new vs test cases or log infos.

@zhenggen-xu , would like to merge this since it is blocking the current tests. As Tyler mentioned, VS test may not be required to cover this but we can plan to add logs in a future iteration if necessary. What do you say?
@tylerlinp , had a discussion with @zhenggen-xu and @yxieca, and we feel it is better to add a log to flag this scenario. Could you please help add the log?
Sorry for late comment. Could you add some gtest or vs test cases to cover the cases you mentioned?
@stepanblyschak Please help review
retest this please

@abdosi We need this PR for 201911 LGTM failure as well. Can you please cherry-pick it? Thanks

> @abdosi We need this PR for 201911 LGTM failure as well. Can you please cherry-pick it? Thanks

Done
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/issues/574 is fixed.

I have been trying to fight this issue for quite a while. it is was first noticed in this pr. https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/4342 judy has spend lots of efforts to track this down. And now I noticed that you have found this issue three weeks ago.

I think we need to enable the swss vs tests for sairedis repo. or at least for every sairedis commit, we need to build and build a new swss vs docker and run the test so that we can find the regression.

> I have been trying to fight this issue for quite a while. it is was first noticed in this pr. [Azure/sonic-buildimage#4342](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/4342) judy has spend lots of efforts to track this down. And now I noticed that you have found this issue three weeks ago.

I'll grab the latest changes and take a look. Now that you point it out it looks like it's consistently xfailing on `test_LagInterfaceSetMtu` instead of `test_PortInterfaceSetMtu` now, so it's possible we need to make a similar change for portchannel interfaces as well?

> I think we need to enable the swss vs tests for sairedis repo. or at least for every sairedis commit, we need to build and build a new swss vs docker and run the test so that we can find the regression.

Agreed.
I think both tests should be fixed.

I fetched the build from Azure/sonic-buildimage#4379 and the normal port is consistently passing locally but I'm still hitting the crash with the LAG test. I need to check the email thread with @kcudnik to see if it's the same failure path as before or if this is a different one.

https://lgtm.com/logs/17a00021acc56bf7a82ba4ade589d7c385cca8bb/lang:cpp

lgtm configuration is good. 

looks like some build issue in the code. @qiluo-msft , can you check if you can fix the code?
retest this please
to enable LGTM
Can we see LGTM C++ results in this PR's checker?

> Can we see LGTM C++ results in this PR's checker?

not until you have merged.

here is the current build. https://lgtm.com/projects/g/Azure/sonic-swss/logs/languages/lang:cpp

We have to first enable the build to be successful, then we can see the analysis results. This pr is just to make neccessary change so that we can build the project successfully in the lgtm enviroment.
@lguohan @qiluo-msft as we have enabled LGTM on 201911, we need this PR as well. Can you help cherry pick it to 201911?

Request for 201911 as per https://github.com/Azure/SONiC/issues/600 @abdosi
Right now the route orch installs routes using sai_route_api, not sai_bitmap_router_api. For the VNET interfaces, it must remain with sai_bitmap_router_api.
This is dependent on PR https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/943. To be merged after #943 is merged
